greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square array T(n,k), n>=0, k>=0, read by antidiagonals, where T(0,k) = 1 and T(n,k) = (1/n) * Sum_{j=1..n} 3^j * binomial(n,j) * binomial(k*n,j-1) for n > 0.
formula: G.f. A_k(x) of column k satisfies A_k(x) = 1 + x * A_k(x)^k * (2 + A_k(x)).
mathematica: T[0, k_] := 1; T[n_, k_] := Sum[3^j * Binomial[n, j] * Binomial[k*n, j - 1], {j, 1, n}]/n; Table[T[k, n - k], {n, 0, 10}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Amiram Eldar_, Jul 27 2020 *)
program: (PARI) {T(n, k) = if(n==0, 1, sum(j=1, n, 3^j*binomial(n, j)*binomial(k*n, j-1))/n)}
(PARI) {T(n, k) = local(A=1+x*O(x^n)); for(i=0, n, A=1+x*A^k*(2+A)); polcoeff(A, n)}
results.author: _Seiichi Manyama_, Jul 26 2020
